block.p: An art review in Weekend on Sept. 1 about the history and collections of seven small museums in Maine commented briefly on a temporary exhibition that had recently opened at the Ogunquit Museum of American Art, ''Painted Air: American Impressionism,'' on view through Oct. 15. After listing some artists represented in the show, the reviewer wrote, ''It needs pruning.''
The show had not yet been installed when the reviewer visited the museum, and the review should have made it clear that the opinion was based on the catalog alone.
